meta.name: EFL Movement Demand Profile - Court Vertical (Basketball Focus)
meta.owner: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
meta.codexReference: §4.4 Population Architecture; Sport Demands Grid v2.2.2; FV Schema v2.1; Load Standards v2.2.0; ICP Definitions v2.3.1
changes_from_v1_4_0: Normalized F-V zone identifiers to canonical Z-style format (Z1-Z8) per ICP Definitions v2.3.1 schema_hints
No functional changes; schema alignment only for cross-document validation compatibility

mdp_definition.description: High-frequency vertical jumping, short-distance sprinting, and rapid direction changes in a confined court space. Emphasizes elastic power, reactive strength, and multi-directional agility.

fv_zone_priorities.notes: Z3 (Elastic-Reactive Power) and Z4 (Velocity) are dominant across all seasons. Z2 (Explosive Strength) supports in off-season. Z6 (Strength-Endurance) used for conditioning blocks.

Youth_8_12.notes: Focus on movement skill acquisition, no depth jumps (E3+), no specialization blocks. Emphasize coordination over performance. General development only.

Youth_13_17.specialization_blocks_limit: ONE block maximum per training year
Youth_13_17.notes: Can progress to elastic plyometrics (E1-E3), introduce E4 cautiously with tier 3 cap. Specialization blocks allowed but limited to ONE per year due to tissue maturation constraints.

Adult.specialization_blocks_limit: TWO blocks maximum per training year (if properly sequenced)
Adult.notes: Full access to elastic spectrum. Can run both elastic + deceleration blocks in single training year if separated by 2+ week baseline buffer.

specialization_blocks_available.description: Basketball-specific specialization blocks that operate within MDP_COURT_VERTICAL framework. These are time-limited, gated, intensive training windows focusing on specific adaptations.

weekly_emphasis_progression: Week 1: Vertical elastic (pogos, box jumps, hurdle hops)
Week 2: Horizontal elastic (bounds, broad jumps, lateral work)
Week 3: Reactive + multi-directional (depth jumps, reactive hurdles) - PEAK INTENSITY

deceleration_specialization.training_emphasis: Braking mechanics, COD efficiency, eccentric control, injury prevention
weekly_emphasis_progression: Week 1: Bilateral braking (eccentric squats, jump stops, decel drills)
Week 2: Unilateral decel + lateral (single-leg work, lateral shuffles)
Week 3: COD + re-acceleration (45/90° cuts, L-drill, multi-directional) - PEAK COMPLEXITY
Week 4: Deload + COD assessment (45% volume reduction)

specialization_block_sequencing.description: Rules for safely combining elastic and deceleration blocks within annual plan

single_block_athletes.rule: Maximum ONE specialization block per training year
single_block_athletes.decision: Choose elastic OR deceleration based on athlete limiter
single_block_athletes.rationale: Tissue maturation and training age constraints limit specialization frequency

dual_block_athletes.rule: Maximum TWO specialization blocks per training year if properly sequenced

legal_sequences.rationale: Elastic = higher CNS demand, run first when freshest. Decel can extend into prep season.
Decel = lower CNS demand, can prime movement quality before elastic. Both stay in off-season.

forbidden_sequences.reason: Overuse injury risk, tissue adaptation failure

early_offseason.rationale: Highest recovery capacity, zero competition load

recommended_blocks: Second block if adult AND first block successful
mid_offseason.rationale: Still adequate recovery capacity if first block went well

late_offseason_prep.rationale: Decel legal in prep season, supports sport-specific movement prep

block_selector_guidance.description: Decision tree for coaches selecting between elastic and deceleration blocks
elastic_block_indicators: Vertical jump is primary limiter (below position avg)
Landing quality good but elastic output low
No injury history - focus is performance enhancement
deceleration_block_indicators: Previous knee injury (ACL, meniscus) - prevention focus
Knee valgus present on cuts (corrective emphasis)
Athlete reports feeling 'out of control on cuts'
baseline_programming_indicators: Athlete is Youth 13-17 AND already completed one specialization block this year
Multiple movement limiters present (needs general development)
Recent injury or training interruption (needs foundational rebuild)

step_1.question: Has athlete completed a specialization block in the last 8 weeks?
step_1.if_yes: USE BASELINE PROGRAMMING (too soon for next block)

step_2.question: Is athlete Youth 13-17 AND already completed one block this training year?

step_4.question: Does athlete meet entry requirements for specialization blocks? (Readiness GREEN, movement quality ≥7/10, no valgus, adequate training exposure)

step_5.question: What is the PRIMARY performance limiter?

movement_mechanics_framework.description: Basketball-specific movement priorities integrated across all programming

vertical_elastic.rationale: Vertical jump central to basketball performance (rebounding, shot blocking, finishing)

deceleration.rationale: Injury prevention (ACL, ankle) and game performance (defensive positioning, closing out)
deceleration.specialization_block_emphasis: Unilateral patterns, COD integration, E0-E2 (decel block only)

lateral_force.rationale: Defensive sliding, lateral cuts, help-side rotations
lateral_force.specialization_block_emphasis: Included in both blocks (elastic: lateral bounds, decel: lateral COD)

landing_control.rationale: Injury prevention and elastic efficiency - poor landing = injury risk + power loss
landing_control.baseline_programming_emphasis: Every session includes landing work (PREP or WORK phase)
landing_control.specialization_block_emphasis: Assessed pre-session, maintained throughout, exit criteria

rotational_trunk.rationale: Shot fakes, passes, defensive denial, contact absorption
rotational_trunk.baseline_programming_emphasis: WORK_B phase most sessions, anti-rotation emphasis
rotational_trunk.specialization_block_emphasis: Maintained in WORK_B of both blocks

upper_body_requirements.description: Basketball-specific upper body work - must NOT interfere with shooting mechanics
upper_body_requirements.rationale: Shooting mechanics require neurological precision. Heavy upper body work creates soreness that disrupts shot quality. Upper body work must support basketball demands without compromising shooting.
basketball_specific_demands: Shot release arm deceleration (eccentric shoulder control)
Scapular endurance for sustained shooting volume
Contact tolerance for rebounding and post play
Anti-rotation for defensive denial and ball protection
Core control for shot stability under fatigue

programming_guidelines.intensity_ceiling: Never exceed 80% 1RM, avoid training to failure
programming_guidelines.tempo_emphasis: Eccentric emphasis for arm deceleration (3-5 second lowers)
programming_guidelines.shooting_compatibility_rule: CRITICAL - If upper body soreness present before shooting practice, volume was too high

scapular_endurance.rationale: Scapular control supports shot mechanics and overhead rebounding

arm_deceleration.rationale: Eccentric strength protects shoulder from repeated shot release deceleration

anti_rotation.rationale: Trunk control for defensive denial and shot stability under contact

contact_tolerance.rationale: Postural strength for rebounding contact and post play

avoid: High-rep bench press (pec soreness affects shot)
Maximal effort upper body days (CNS + soreness)
Any exercise that causes upper body soreness >24 hours
contraindications.rationale: Basketball is lower-body dominant sport. Upper body work is supportive, not primary. Shooting precision > upper body strength.

phase_structure: Weeks 1-4: General development OR Elastic Specialization Block
Weeks 7-10: Continued development OR Deceleration Specialization Block

PREP_SEASON.phase_structure: Bridge to competition, sport-specific movement emphasis, volume reduction
PREP_SEASON.note: Decel block can extend into prep if started in off-season

POST_SEASON.phase_structure: Active recovery, movement quality restoration, tissue healing

baseline_programming.description: Default MDP_COURT_VERTICAL programming when NOT in specialization block
baseline_programming.session_structure: PRIME → PREP → WORK_A (plyo/sprint) → WORK_B (upper body) → CLEAR
baseline_programming.exercise_selection: Filter AETHER by season, population, readiness, then apply zone emphasis
baseline_programming.volume_calculation: Use seasonal_programming_defaults for contacts/sprint meters per session
baseline_programming.specialization_check: Before generating any session, check if athlete is in active specialization block

specialization_block_activation.validation: EPA validates entry_requirements before generating week 1
specialization_block_activation.generation: EPA uses block-specific weekly_structure, not baseline MDP rules
specialization_block_activation.transition: EPA validates exit_criteria before returning to baseline programming

block_to_baseline_transition.post_block_recovery: EPA generates 3-7 day recovery window (Z8 only)

changes: Normalized F-V zone identifiers to canonical Z-style format (Z1-Z8) per ICP Definitions v2.3.1 schema_hints
No functional changes; schema alignment only for cross-document validation compatibility
Expanded training_goals to include specialization outcomes

v1.3.0.changes: Previous version without specialization block integration
